txt.en: Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Defeat Orcs at Avabárg ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'I hope that I am not a burden to you.'
Ai-thúda
'In many ways the story of my people begins with King Marhári, of the Northmen.'
'Frumgar was victorious. It was said, however, defeat only stoked the Orcs’ thirst for blood. Thirteen years later the Orcs returned to raze the Ai-thúda's lands and sack Avabárg.'

'I hope that I am not a burden to you. I could use a companion on my travels. It is a boon to my research that you accompany me with your current knowledge of these lands and your skill in combat. I have heard the north can be a harsh place at times.\n\n'Now then, I suppose we'd best be off. The story of the Rohirrim begins, in many ways, at Avabárg.'
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.

'In many ways the story of my people begins with King Marhári, of the Northmen. Disaster befell the Thíuda during the Battle of the Plains against the Wainriders. When King Marhári fell in that battle, his son Marhwini led the survivors on a long journey in search of a new home, ultimately resettling here.\n\n'Marhwini’s people, the Ai-thúda or Horse-folk, were not well satisfied dwelling in the Vales. They desired open country where they could ride and graze their herds. Their scouts found this in the Floodfells, but Marhwini deemed it too rough and untamable a land, and too close to the threat of Angmar, to halt with his war-weary people.'
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Orcs can be found at Avabárg.\n\nYou should defeat Orcs at Avabárg.
Talk to Léothred elsewhere in Avabárg
'Let us defeat these Orcs and honour the hardship endured by the Horse-folk for so many years.'
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Léothred, the Rohirric scholar, wishes to learn more about the history of his people on the isle of Avabárg.

Forthári
Forthwini
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Frumgar

'Here Marhwini built the hall of Avabárg and named it the chief fortress of the Ai-thúda. This was not the safest of places, though. The coming of the Horse-folk roused the Orcs of Hithaeglir, who attacked them again and again over the next century. Both Marhwini’s son Forthwini and his grandson Forthári fell in battle to the Orcs, leaving only Forthári’s youngest son as heir.'
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.

'Forthári’s youngest son was Frumgar, a boy of twelve, now Chieftain of the Ai-thúda. While still a youth, Frumgar became a hero of his people, befriending both the Longbeard Dwarves and the Wizards Gandalf the Grey and Barandil the Brown.'
'Frumgar even received an ancient sword of Westernesse, which he named Wrothbláda, from Curunír the White. With these allies he defeated the Orcs in battle at the age of seventeen.'
Avabárg can be found in Woodsedge in the Vales of Anduin.\n\nYou should travel to Avabárg.

Marhwini
'Our people tire from the journey.'
Talk to Léothred at Avabárg
'So be it. We shall settle here.'
'It is an honour to meet you.'
'I shall lead my people with this gift you have given me.'
'Frumgar and his warriors defeated the marauders, but afterward his lands lay in ruin.'
'Where, where is my wife?!'
'His wife’s body lay among the ashes of his hall. She died there having given birth to their only son.'
